intro: Bersama abyssinica var. nyassae, commonly known as the Abyssinian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and distinctive, palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to poor soil conditions. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
